title: What is the importance of values education in junior high school? - Quora

response.answer_text: The importance, of values education, in junior high school, is to instill, in the students, good manners and right conduct (GMRC). In the Philippines, values education is first taught to third grade students, in elementary school. That early, so that the children grow up right.

Greetings, Young adolescents possess an elevated sense of right, wrong, and especially, fairness. Middle school is an ideal place for schools to provide instruction on justice, citizenship, civic responsibilities, and how people can participate in community activities. Civically active adults who benefitted from character education frequently cite their middle school years as having been formatively influential on their commitment to serve fellow citizens. Best wishes for every success. Sincerely, AJG.
